Class Problem

  • java.lang.Object
    • Problem
  • public class Problem
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a problem instance for vehicle routing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Problem()

      Randomly fills the problem with clients, depots, and assigns random time costs.

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Solves the vehicle routing problem.

      • printProblem

        public void printProblem​(boolean printMatrix,
                         boolean printActors)
        Prints the problem including the cost matrix and actors (clients, depots, vehicles).
        Parameters:
        printMatrix - True if the cost matrix should be printed.
        printActors - True if the actors (clients, depots, vehicles) should be printed.

      • getSolution

        public Solution getSolution()
        Gets the solution to the vehicle routing problem.
        Returns:
        The solution.

      • getVehicles

        public Vehicle[] getVehicles()
        Gets an array of vehicles from the depots.
        Returns:
        An array of vehicles.

      • printMatrix

        public static void printMatrix​(int[][] matrix)
        Prints a matrix to the console.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to print.

      • addClients

        public void addClients​(Client... args)
        Adds clients to the problem instance.
        Parameters:
        args - The clients to add.

      • addDepots

        public void addDepots​(Depot... args)
        Adds depots to the problem instance.
        Parameters:
        args - The depots to add.

      • randomlyFillProblem

        public void randomlyFillProblem​(int timeIntervalStart,
                                int timeIntervalEnd,
                                int timeIntervalSections,
                                int clientsPerSection,
                                int depotsNum,
                                int vehiclePerDepotNum,
                                int timeCostMin,
                                int timeCostMax)
        Randomly fills the problem with clients, depots, and assigns random time costs.
        Parameters:
        timeIntervalStart - Start of the time interval.
        timeIntervalEnd - End of the time interval.
        timeIntervalSections - Number of time interval sections.
        clientsPerSection - Number of clients per time interval section.
        depotsNum - Number of depots.
        vehiclePerDepotNum - Number of vehicles per depot.
        timeCostMin - Minimum time cost.
        timeCostMax - Maximum time cost.
